page.title: 16BROADFORD VILLAGE HALL
page.content: {Broadford Village Hall}has three rooms plus a kitchen and toilets.It can seat two hundred and thirty people in the main hall and the main clubroom can seat fifty people.When extension work begins this summer the kitchen will be made into a clubroom and a 126 square metre extention costing approximatley 50 thousand pounds will provide cafe facilities and can seat 170 people. The present hall is used as an indoor games centre and theatre to which will be added showers and a new kitchen. A new roof is to replace the existing asbestos tiled structure which leaks badly. A number of clubs use the hall at present including the drama club, badminton club, W.R.I.and Brownies though many have left due to the poor facilities.The hall's main finances are derived from dances and sales by outside agencies.
